Client¶

class NodeactylClient(host, key)¶

Main class constructor

Arguments

  • host – Where your panel is hosted (EG: http(s)://panel.host.net/)

Account¶

getAccountDetails()¶

NodeactylClient.getAccountDetails()¶

Gets the account details associated with this.hostUrl and this.hostKey

MUST USE ClientAPI Key!!! Application API Keys NO LONGER WORK with ANY Pterodactyl version 1 and above!

Returns

Promise.<Object> –

getAccountPermissions()¶

NodeactylClient.getAccountPermissions()¶

Gets the permissions that this associated host and key have

MUST USE ClientAPI Key!!! Application API Keys NO LONGER WORK with ANY Pterodactyl version 1 and above!

Returns

Promise.<unknown> –

updateEmail()¶

NodeactylClient.updateEmail(newEmail, currentPassword)¶

Updates the email for the specified host and API key

Arguments

  • newEmail (String) – New Email

  • currentPassword (String) – Current Password

Returns

Promise.<Boolean> –

updatePassword()¶

NodeactylClient.updatePassword(newPassword, currentPassword)¶

Updates the password for the specified host and api key

Arguments

  • newPassword (String) – New Password

  • currentPassword (String) – Current Password

Returns

Promise.<Boolean> –

Server Details¶

getServerDetails()¶

NodeactylClient.getServerDetails(serverId)¶

Gets a Server’s information NOTE: This does not return any live resource usages such as CPU, memory or RAM, but it will show the max limits of these values

Arguments

  • serverId (String) – Server Id

Returns

Promise.<unknown> –

getServerStatus()¶

NodeactylClient.getServerStatus(serverId)¶

Gets a server’s status, so whether it is running, starting or powered off

Arguments

  • serverId (String) – Server Id

Returns

Promise.<unknown> –

getAllServers()¶

NodeactylClient.getAllServers()¶

Gets a list of servers from your panel, currently this only get the first page

Returns

Promise.<unknown> –

getServerPage()¶

NodeactylClient.getServerPage(pageNum)¶

Gets a server by a specified page number

Arguments

  • pageNum (Integer) – Page number

Returns

Promise.<unknown> –

getServerUsages()¶

NodeactylClient.getServerUsages(serverId)¶

Gets a servers current memory/cpu/disk usages as bytes

Arguments

  • serverId (String) – Server Id

Returns

Promise.<unknown> –

getConsoleWebSocket()¶

NodeactylClient.getConsoleWebSocket(serverId)¶

Gets the Console WebSocket instance for a server you will need to establish your own socket connection for now (try socket.io)

Arguments

  • serverId (String) – Server Id

Returns

Promise.<unknown> –

getSubUsers()¶

NodeactylClient.getSubUsers(serverId)¶

Get subusers of a server

Arguments

  • serverId (String) – Server Id

Returns

Promise.<unknown> –

getApiKeys()¶

NodeactylClient.getApiKeys()¶

Gets a list of API keys that this assigned host and key have available to them

MUST USE ClientAPI Key!!! Application API Keys NO LONGER WORK with ANY Pterodactyl version 1 and above!

Returns

Promise.<unknown> –

createApiKey()¶

NodeactylClient.createApiKey(description, allowedIps)¶

Creates an API key with specified host and api key. WILL NOT PROVIDE SUPPORT FOR THIS COMMAND!!!!!! Make sure to read that previous line ^

Arguments

  • description (String) –

  • allowedIps (Array) –

Returns

Promise.<unknown> –

deleteApiKey()¶

NodeactylClient.deleteApiKey(keyId)¶

Deletes a specified API key. Only use the API key identifier provided to you on the panel

Arguments

  • keyId (Integer) – Key Id

Returns

Promise.<Boolean> –

Server Backups¶

listServerBackups()¶

NodeactylClient.listServerBackups(serverId)¶

Lists what backups a server has

Arguments

  • serverId (String) – Server Id

Returns

Promise.<Array> –

createServerBackup()¶

NodeactylClient.createServerBackup(serverId)¶

Creates a backup for a specified server

This will send a error code 924 when trying to create 2 backups within a 10 minute time frame

Arguments

  • serverId (String) – Server Id

Returns

Promise.<Object> –

getBackupDetails()¶

NodeactylClient.getBackupDetails(serverId, backupId)¶

Gets details about a specified server backups

Arguments

  • serverId (String) – Server Id

  • backupId (Integer) – Backup Id

Returns

Promise.<Object> –

getBackupDownload()¶

NodeactylClient.getBackupDownload(serverId, backupId)¶

Gets a clickable URL to download your server backup

Arguments

  • serverId (String) – Server Id

  • backupId (Integer) – Backup Id

Returns

Promise.<Object> –
